articles.caption: A look at why IP matters by @naavik_co
articles.title: Why Multiversus IP Matters — Naavik
articles.description:
MultiVersus has found its stride, making headlines with 20M players. We 
take a look at what’s making the game so popular, its mechanics and IP 
potential, and tease our latest Naavik Pro game deconstruction on Beatstar.

articles.caption: A look at Tencent & Sony buying 30% of Elden Ring (From Software)
articles.title: Tencent, Sony Collectively Acquire 30 Percent Of Elden Ring Developer From Software - Game Informer
articles.description: The Kadokawa Corporation is still by far the largest shareholder, though.

articles.title: Xsolla: Apple and Google are “the grandpas that overstayed their welcome at Christmas” - Mobilegamer.biz
articles.description: Regional director of Europe Miikka Luotio says the tech giants are holding the games business back. Here’s why.

articles.caption: A look at Guildfi H1 2022 Report
articles.title: GuildFi on Twitter
articles.description:
“Our H1 2022 Report highlights how the team has been working hard on creating a product market fit in line with #web3 gaming through our community, partnerships, and strategic investments.

articles.caption: A look at Sprocket Games raising $5M.
articles.title: Sprocket Games raises $5M for its debut title, a social adventure game | VentureBeat
articles.description: Nascent studio Sprocket Games announced today it has raised $5 million in funding. The company, which was founded by veterans of Riot Games, Google, Blizzard, Obsidian, and CCP Games, plans to use this money to build its team. Josiah Kiehl, Jo Graylock, Nicolas Tittley, and Reina Sweet founded Sprocket this year. They hope to create […]

articles.caption: A look at Koop raising $5M
articles.title: Koop raises $5M to enable communities and creators to raise funds with NFTs | VentureBeat
articles.description: Koop raised $5M to enable communities and creators to raise funds with NFTs. Already $850 million has flowed into Koop projects.
